Question 1
==========
See val_test01_solved.cpp and val_test02_solved.cpp.


Question 2
==========
(The below timings were generated on the box890 CIMS desktop machine.)

Question 3
==========
I optimized the sin4_vec function.


Question 4
==========
I optimized the dot product using pipelining. The results below are for different vector sizes and
two unroll factors. Unrolling by 8, we see about a 15% speed-up. Unrolling by 16, we see a 40-50%
speed-up. (The code is in dot-product.cpp.)

repeats = 50, N = 1e6, unroll factor = 8
----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.00098s
time per pipelined dot: 0.00085s

repeats = 50, N = 1e7, unroll factor = 8
----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.01027s
time per pipelined dot: 0.00889s

repeats = 50, N = 1e8, unroll factor = 8
----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.10048s
time per pipelined dot: 0.08461s

repeats = 50, N = 1e6, unroll factor = 16
-----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.00100s
time per pipelined dot: 0.00054s

repeats = 50, N = 1e7, unroll factor = 16
-----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.01025s
time per pipelined dot: 0.00683s

repeats = 50, N = 1e8, unroll factor = 16
-----------------------------------------
time per naive dot:     0.10085s
time per pipelined dot: 0.06419s
